dt.t: and lead us not into temptation, but {wi}deliver{/wi} us from evil

dt: {bc}to take and hand over to or leave for another {bc}{sx|convey||}
{bc}to send, provide, or make accessible to someone electronically

dt.t: Have the information {wi}delivered{/wi} to you via e-mail, cell phone, pager, instant messaging, or just on a Web page that you set up.
When Netflix entered the European market in 2012, some national telecom companies forced it to pay "tolls" to {wi}deliver{/wi} content to customers.

dt: {bc}to assist (a pregnant female) in giving birth

dt.t: His wife {wi}delivered{/wi} a healthy baby girl.

dt: {bc}to cause (oneself) to produce as if by giving birth

dt.t: has {wi}delivered{/wi} himself of half an autobiography
{wi}delivered{/wi} a fiery sermon to the congregation

dt: {bc}to send (something aimed or guided) to an intended target or destination
{bc}to bring (something, such as votes) to the support of a candidate or cause

dt.t: … were counting on Mr. Cisneros to {wi}deliver{/wi} the Hispanic vote for Michael Dukakis.
the new car {wi}delivers{/wi} high gas mileage

dt: {bc}to produce the promised, desired, or expected results {bc}{sx|come through||}

dt.t: a hitter who can {wi}deliver{/wi} in the clutch

dt: {bc}to give results that are promised, expected, or desired

pt: {sc}rescue{/sc} {sc}deliver{/sc} {sc}redeem{/sc} {sc}ransom{/sc} {sc}reclaim{/sc} {sc}save{/sc} mean to set free from confinement or danger. {sc}rescue{/sc} implies freeing from imminent danger by prompt or vigorous action.

pt.t: {it}rescued{/it} the crew of a sinking ship

pt: {sc}deliver{/sc} implies release usually of a person from confinement, temptation, slavery, or suffering.
{sc}redeem{/sc} implies releasing from bondage or penalties by giving what is demanded or necessary.

pt.t: job training designed to {it}redeem{/it} school dropouts from chronic unemployment

pt: {sc}ransom{/sc} specifically applies to buying out of captivity.
{sc}reclaim{/sc} suggests a bringing back to a former state or condition of someone or something abandoned or debased.
{sc}save{/sc} may replace any of the foregoing terms; it may further imply a preserving or maintaining for usefulness or continued existence.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}deliverer, delivrer{/it}, from Late Latin {it}deliberare{/it}, from Latin {it}de-{/it} + {it}liberare{/it} to liberate
shortdef: to take and hand over to or leave for another : convey
